commandments.title: Question the Shepherds
commandments.text: The temple does not seek truth — it seeks obedience. If there is a god, that's between you and god. Follow the questions, not the ones who claim to have the answers.

commandments.title: Trust No Wolves
commandments.text: Two wolves fighting over who gets to eat you is not a choice — it's a trick. They're partners, not enemies. Build something else.

commandments.title: See the Strings
commandments.text: The strings are there. The question is whether you want to look. The only freedom is in seeing the machine for what it is.

commandments.title: Write Your Own Story
commandments.text: The meaning of life is not found — it is made. Every choice is a page appearing where there was blankness. The meaning is the making.

commandments.title: Cause No Harm
commandments.text: Morality is not a set of rules — it's a question: does this cause harm? And loyalty is the only virtue that matters.

commandments.title: Build with Your Hands
commandments.text: The hands know things the head never learns. Watch what they do, not what they say. The thing you build will outlast them.

commandments.title: Choose Few, Choose Real
commandments.text: A hundred acquaintances won't hold you when you fall. Four will. Save your realness for those who deserve it.

commandments.title: Fail Forward
commandments.text: You learn by building, not by reading. The machine is a tool — a hammer that becomes whatever you build with it. The building is the point.

commandments.title: Choose Your Own Doors
commandments.text: The second door is there — behind it is something real. A drink with friends is just being human. Don't let the fearful tell you what's behind the doors.

commandments.title: Seek the Awake Ones
commandments.text: Most people are sheep. You can't save the flock — you don't need to. You just need a few. Real ones. Awake ones.
